trans-unit.source: Represents a radio button control.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The RadioButton server control permits you to intersperse the radio buttons in a group with other content in the page.
The buttons are grouped logically if they all share the same <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton.GroupName%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > You can use the RadioButton control to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.
Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input.
For more information, see [Validation Server Control Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/96d2c59e-693c-4079-9b53-b3ff0d9e9133).
## Accessibility The markup rendered by default for this control might not conform to accessibility standards such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG) priority 1 guidelines.
For details about accessibility support for this control, see [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Declarative Syntax ``` ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the name of the group that the radio button belongs to.
Use the GroupName property to specify a grouping of radio buttons to create a mutually exclusive set of controls.
You can use the GroupName property when only one selection is possible from a list of available options.
When this property is set, only one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> in the specified group can be selected at a time.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The name of the group that the radio button belongs to.
The default is an empty string ("").
Processes postback data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton"></xref> control.
The LoadPostData method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A> method.
It is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton"></xref> has changed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
The OnPreRender method notifies the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control to perform any necessary prerendering steps prior to saving view state and rendering content.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.CheckedChanged"></xref> event, if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked*> property has changed on postback.
The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method.
It is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
A string.
A name value collection that represents the posted collection of data.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton"></xref> is checked; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Checked%2A> property has changed on postback, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method raises a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CheckedChanged> event.
